body.p: The paranasal sinuses are which make the skull .

response.name: hollow areas
response.feedback: Correct. The paranasal sinuses are hollow spaces in the skull lined with ciliated epithelial cells.

response.name: passageways
response.feedback: Incorrect. A foramen or a meatus would be a passageway through a bone.

response.name: lighter
response.feedback: Correct. The paranasal sinuses are filled with air which helps to decrease the weight of the skull.

response.name: stronger
response.feedback: Incorrect. The sinus actual make the skull slightly weaker because they are hollow and not as hard as the compact bone of the adjacent parts.

body.p: The sinuses can become filled with when a person has a cold which will alter the persons .

response.name: air
response.feedback: Incorrect. Sinuses are hollow spaces that normally contain air, they will help to humidify and warm it.

response.name: fluid
response.feedback: Correct. During a cold the sinuses can fill with excess fluid.

response.name: balance
response.feedback: Incorrect. Unless the infection spreads to the inner ear, fluid in the sinuses does not affect balance.

response.name: voice
response.feedback: Correct. Speech and sound resonate in the sinuses so when they are full of fluid sound of the voice can be altered.
